home.title: National Gallery - Simple Site Example
home.content:
An additional local title can be added


This is an example of a small set of related html pages created automatically based on a set of three json[@@] files.

Example Button

Button or images or any html markup can be added in to form the bulk of the content[@@] and then presented as a simple html page on Github[@@]
footnotes: Here we can place a lot more detail about this issue.
home.content right: Additional information easily be added as a second column without the need for more complex html.

github.title: National Gallery - Simple Site Example
github.content: This site has been setup as a working example of how a simple set of html pages can be generated from a set of json files, more information can be found on GitHub. This will allow details of all issues, comments and even older versions of the process to be publicly organised and presented.
github.content right:
{
"home": {
	"title": "National Gallery - Simple Site Example",
	"content": "<h3>An additional local title can be added</h3><br/><p>This is an example of a small set of related html pages created automatically based on a set of three json[@@] files.</p><center><a class=\"btn btn-outline-primary nav-button\" style=\"left:80px;\" id=\"nav-models\" role=\"button\" href=\"./\">Example Button</a></center><br/><p>Button or images or any html markup can be added in to form the bulk of the content.</p>",
	"footnotes": [

		"https://github.com/",
		"Here we can place a lot more detail about this issue."],
	"content right": "Additional information easily be added as a second column without the need for more complex html."

"github": {
	"title": "National Gallery - Simple Site Example",
	"content": "<p>This site has been setup as a working example of how a simple set of html pages can be generated from a set of json files, more information can be found on <a href=\"https://github.com/jpadfield/simple-site\">GitHub</a>. about.title: National Gallery - Simple Site Example
about.content: This system was set up to allow a series of github repositories to have similar sets of supporting webpages with minimal effort for each one.
